Name: Global War 1936-1945: Elite of the Soviet Union
Description:
OVERVIEW
Historical Board Gaming is excited to present the Elite of the Soviet Union © expansion. An expansion involving the Soviet Guards Units (Guards)  and the ‘Order of the Red Banner’ in World War II.

SET CONTENTS
-30 Guards Division Markers
-10 Order of the Red Banner Markers
-1 For The Capture Of Berlin Marker
-2 Guards Bomber Regiment Markers
-2 3D printed Po-2 night bombers

1.0 GUARDS

1.1 Overview
The USSR player can award Guards status to units that distinguished themselves in battle to boost moral and create elite units. Over 120 infantry divisions alone were given Guards status during the war.
Guards units were given better and more weapons, ammunition and vehicles than regular divisions. Guards divisions were sometimes reformed for various reasons. Some Guards units knew multiple formations during the war. These promotion rules replace the Soviet Union’s Guards Infantry rules on the Soviet Union’s National Reference Sheet in the Global War 1936 rules.

-description from publisher

Name: Global War 1914-1918
Description:
Historical Board Gaming is proud to present The Great War (Global War 1914-1918) - the ultimate World War I strategic game.   If you’ve played our Global War series, Axis & Allies or similar games, this game will seem quite familiar to you as basic mechanics and turn structure of the game are similar.   However, there are many changes and new features that make this game unique to the era.

For starters, The Great War is a strategic global (not a euro-centric) examination of the war.  The strategic concerns of many competing powers across the globe have been factored in to create a game that can have long-lasting ramifications.

—description from the publisher

Name: Global War 1962
Description: The Missiles of October have triggered a Global War between the US and Russia as well as their Allies. Staying in the flavor of the Global War games, this Cold War gone hot will not let you down.

Name: FateShifters
Description: FateShifters (è½‰å‘½å¸«) is a card game that combines elements from astrology, astral myth, and tarot to compose several different game rules to suit players' gaming preferences, including storytelling, area control, trick-taking, etc.

Name: Tavernin
Description:
Tavernin is a Poker-like game in which players attempt to build the highest valued party and bet against the other players using custom chips. The player with the highest valued hand collects the chips.

Players start with 5 cards and use "uno" like rules to connect the cards into a party. Each card has a banner at its center that asks a requirement to be met before it adds value to your party.

There are 2 different types of value that your party accrues. Levels which are the main tier of value, and Power which are secondary but still important.

EX: The Warrior 4 card asks that you have 2 matching color cards in your party. If you meet the requirement the card grants 4 Power to your party’s total value.

A traditional round goes:


     All players Ante or big/small blinds (Preference)
     All players dealt 5 cards
     Initial round of betting occurs.
     Discard phase.
     Final round of betting occurs.
     Call.


—description from the designer

Name: シスターズチェイン (Sisters Chain)
こんなブラックな魔王様はイヤだっ!! (Konnna Black na Maou Sama wa Iya Da!!)
BAGANI The Card Game
Description:
-From The Designer Page
Sarimaw and his Monsters are attacking Sansinukob! You will need to call on the help of the Bagani to defeat the Monsters and save the "Sansinukob" (World).

In Bagani: the Card Game, you will form Combinations of Bagani cards with Lakas (Power), Ganda (Beauty), Lakam (Nobility), Dumakulem, and Mayari. Use the different combinations to defeat the Monsters of Sarimaw. For each Monster you defeat, you will get Dangal (Honor) Points. The player with the most Honor at the end of the game is the winner and savior of Sansinukob!

Name: Hugot
Description:
"Lahat tayo may pinagdadaanan.
Lahat tayo may pinaglalaban.
Lahat may hugot.
Para sa inyo'to."
-Words seen at the box cover (In Filipino)

The card game is pretty straight-forward and takes the mechanics of other familiar voting-party games. The "Hugot Master"(active player) draws a card from the red hugot card pile, which contains specific scenarios such as “describe mo ang crush mo” (describe your crush). The other players would then pick a black hugot card, which contains a single word, from their hand and make a hugot out of it. The one with the best hugot chosen by the Hugot Master wins the round and keeps the red hugot card. The first to gain five red hugot card wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Crazier Eights: One Thousand & One Nights
Description:
A gateway fantasy card game. This is a stand alone version of Crazier Eights with fifty two cards and an Arabian Nights theme. Every card has a unique ability and the first player with zero cards in hand wins.

Players take turns drawing a card, playing up to one card, and discarding up to one card.

This version can be mixed with other versions of Crazier Eights printed in 2017 or after.

—description from the publisher

Name: Luminous Ages
Description:
GAME SYSTEM

    
    
         This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.

    


Luminous Ages: Dragon Dreams is a versatile living card game. Where the goal is to Summon a Dream God (normally a dragon). To do this you have to slowly build up energy while protecting your armies and lands and attacking your opponents.

It comes as four premade decks however players are also welcome to mix cards and create their own personalised decks. The premade decks are designed to be powerful but balanced, giving no true advantage to personalised decks but instead focusing on skill.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hazard Mountain: An Inference Game
Description:
"Correctly making inferences will help you blast down the mountain to win."
An educational game in which players will:

     make inferences
     understand and analyze text
     read for meaning


(Reading Comprehension: Level 2)

Players read 'question cards' with a short text and answer the accompanying question based on the text. Correctly answering the question allows them to roll the die and move down the ski hill to a new square. Specially marked squares along the way cause special events, such as losing a turn or helping another player.  The first one to the bottom wins.

—user summary

Name: Hildarting
Description:
Hildarting is a strategic game of area control settled in the Faroer Islands during the Viking Age.

The board represents the islands and regions of the Faroer arcipelago. Each player starts with a number of regions under their control, and the goal of the game is to conquer other regions. In the end, only one player will remain to be the ruler of the Faroer. The mechanics and the game goal resemble very much the classic Risk.

In turns, players move region to region by sea or by land. Entering other players' regions causes conflict, and the winner of the battle claims the region.

—description from the publisher

Name: Honey Pot Hop: A Musical Party Game
Description:
This game features two unique games, each utilizing a mechanical, talking Winnie the Pooh figure.

Set-up for both games is the same: place Pooh in the centre of the floor. Arrange the six character circles in a large circle around Pooh. All players start on a different character circle.

Bee Bop

Place the Bee Tokens next to Pooh, then push the honey bee button on Pooh once to start the game, and then once more to select the Bee Bop game.

Pooh will then give a direction (such as "bounce like Tigger") and begin playing music. All players must move around the circle, following the direction given by Pooh. When the music stops, each player must stand on a different character circle. Pooh will then name one of the six characters. If a player is standing on that character circle, they collect a Bee Token, and a new round begins.

The game ends when one player has collected 3 Bee Tokens OR when Pooh ends the game, at which point the player with the most Bee Tokens wins.

Honey Hop

Push the honey bee button on Pooh once to start the game, and then twice more to select the Bee Bop game.

Pooh will then give a direction (such as "scratch your head like Rabbit") and then begin playing music. All players must move around the circle, following the direction given by Pooh. When the music stop, all players stop and listen to Pooh. Pooh will then name characters, equal to the number of players minus one. So if there are 3 players, Pooh will name off two characters. Players run to try and stand on one of the character circles named by Pooh. The player who is not standing on one of the characters named is eliminated.

Remaining players continue playing another round. This time Pooh will name one less character. Players continue playing until only one player has not been eliminated at the end of a round.

—user summary

Name: Gangfight Skirmish Game System
Description:
If you're like us, you have too many miniatures and too little time to learn every game out there. Never fear, the Gangfight Skirmish Game System is here! With our all new hardcover rulebook, you will learn how to play games in any setting, with any miniatures you want! Perhaps you'd like to see if a Warjack can kill a Dreadnought? Or maybe you'd like to create a heroic warband with fantasy characters from 4 different game systems? All of this is possible with the Gangfight Skirmish Game System!

The Gangfight Skirmish Game System features unique characters, alternating activations, ongoing campaigns, fast & fun gameplay, lots of skills, custom equipment and more!

—description from the publisher

Name: SEVEN: 4 Players Expansion
Description:
SEVEN is a tile-stacking game that uses polyhexes of 4 hexagons, called tetrahexes. There are 7 different tetrahexes (hence the name of the game).

Players alternate turns placing one of their tiles according to some simple rules, trying to get the most of their pieces on the topmost layers when the game ends.

The rules also include a variant and some puzzles.

This stand alone expansion contains the same components as the base game, but in red and blue:

- 7 red tetrahexes
- 7 blue tetrahexes
- cotton case

As a standalone product, it allows 2 player games, just like the base game.

As an expansion, it allows two types of gameplay:

- 3 player
- 2 vs 2 players; with pairs sitting in front of each other.

The game has been proven to be non-suitable for 4 player games (too chaotic), hence the 2 vs 2 game mode.

Name: Twigs: 4 players expansion
Description:
Twigs is a tile-laying game that uses polytwigs of 5 segments called ‘pentatwigs’. There are 12 different pentatwigs (discarding symmetries).

Players alternate turns placing one of their pentatwigs according to some simple rules, trying to enclose as many areas as possible.

This stand alone expansion contains the same components as the base game, but in red and blue:

- 12 red pentatwigs
- 12 blue pentatwigs
- 15 red discs
- 15 blue discs
- cotton case

As a standalone game (being exactly as the base game) it allows for 2 player games.

As an expansion, it allows 3 and 4 player games.

-description from publisher

Name: Forestia
Description:
"The animals in the forest are small and shy, they only play with an animal of the same age or their family. "

Forestia is a card game of discarding from 3 years.
The first player to discard all his cards wins a token.
The goal of the game is to be the first to win the number of chips expected early in the game.

     2 chips: for the youngest, and games with a large number of participants
     3 chips: for the most adventurous players.


The duration of a game is less than 5 minutes, which corresponds to the concentration capacity of a 3-year-old child.

Forestia is a fun way to learn how to count and count from 1 to 3. It is an intellectually complex task for a child to count, not recite 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. This game allows you to play with the colors, then gently bring the child to count the candles on the cards to learn how to count while having fun. Then the first tactics with the first special card: the Joker card.

Forestia is an evolving game with the addition of special cards as the child evolves. At 6 or 7 years old, the child can play with all the cards.

Note: it is possible to play up to 12 players with 2 boxes of Forestia.

The ergonomics of the cards have been studied to allow to play with right-handers as left-handed. In addition each color is associated with only 1 symbol, which makes it easy to play with people with visual impairment.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vilar de Mouros 2018
Description:
Vilar de Mouros 2018 is an expansion for Vilar de Mouros with 8 new cards (7 game cards and 1 bonus card) and a note pad to add the points.
Two of the new game cards (Pretenders and Peter Murphy) are upgrades, so we recommend that you play without the original ones.
If you want to keep them, we recommend that the 2 cards from the same band cannot be held by the same player at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Tiny Epic Defenders (Second Edition): Kickstarter Deluxe Promo Pack
Description:
This promo pack includes 5 new defenders: The Sullied (Human Necromancer), Brutus (Goblin Assassin), Gamelyn (Guardian of the Order), Kyrie (Valkyrie Avenger) and Methusael (Undead Revenant).

It also includes 2 new artifacts cards and items: Baal's Bait and Gavel of Gamelyn.
Also added are 2 epic foes: Overlord and Fire Elemental and 2 dire enemies: Giant Snake and Basilisk.

Name: Tiny Epic Defenders: The Dark War – Kickstarter Deluxe Promo Pack
Description: This Kickstarter semi-exclusive pack includes a box sleeve to hold the expansion and base game together. The pack adds 3 new defenders: Conjurer, Armorer, and Mechanic. It also includes cards and items for 2 new artifacts: Aughmoore's Gamble and Skull of Baal. There are 4 new epic foes: Giant Mantis, Ghost Ship, Grotesque, and Vampire Lord (Ice Golem was originally slated to be included, but is in the base game instead), along with 4 new dire enemies: Mimic, Sirens, Nomads, and Wolfrats.

Name: Rezonite
Description:
Rezonite is a two player duel where you battle using cards that represent mystical crystals. The goal of the game is to be the first player to reach a victory condition, which are printed on certain cards. This means you must cast a spell that has a victory condition and then use your other spells to help you achieve that condition, while preventing your opponent from achieving theirs first.

You get three willpower on your turn, which can be spent like action points to do things like draw and play cards. Spells are played face down, and remain that way until you manifest them. This gives you plenty of opportunities to bluff and outwit your opponent.

Every card in your deck is unique and every card can be played as either a spell or as energy. The choices you make about which cards to play as energy and which ones to play as spells can have a massive impact on the outcome of the game.

The core set comes with 150 cards, divided into 5 preconstructed decks. You can play with any of these decks, or build your own deck by combining any 30 Rezonite cards. There are no restrictions on which cards can go together, but think carefully about which energy types and victory conditions to include in your Rezonite deck.

—description from the publisher

Name: Above and Below: Megaland Bonus Cards
Description:
A four pack of cards for Above and Below included with Megaland, hidden under the insert.

Shuffle the new key card with the other key cards, and the new star cards with the other star cards. Set up as normal.

Name: The Rangers: Rise of War
Description:
An Adventure Battle Game

Build / Quest / Conquer

Your Squad + An Epic Game = Memories that Last

The Rangers: Rise of War is meant to be played as a 4-6 hour epic strategy game, or however long you all want to keep it going! Sure, we have rules to make the gameplay quicker, but this is supposed to bring friends together and battle for the ultimate victory.

Players control an army that has a specific alley in play. Players can choose to focus on their Heroes or begin to diversify their armies by upgrading buildings unlocking more strategic pieces, such as Archers or Calvary.

You may advance out capturing areas of the board that translates into coin and gives you a spell card or keep your hero in place and quest for epic gear and more.

There are many goals to win the game. If you are able to get both swords of power into your capital, bring 4 breeds to your capital or go for complete annihilation by taking out both of your enemy’s main capitals to win. Micro-games may have other added ways to win in order to condense the game time. Micro-games may also start with buildings already in place.

The game is set in the world of Adrasil. The Rangers has had several films projects as seen on The Fantasy Network, related to it as well as a comic, and a live-action event called "Weekend Warrior”.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Realms: Pact Cutter Promo Card
Description: Star Realms: Pact Cutter Promo Card is a Blob/Trade Federation Ship promo card for use with Star Realms.

Name: Super Stadium Baseball
Description: Baseball simulation with manually-operated, mechanical pitching and batting.

Name: Trivia Crack
Description:
A board game based off of the popular app of the same name.

Answer questions about US history, sports, science, geography, art, and entertainment. The first player to collect all 6 character tokens wins.

On a player's turn, they spin a spinner and answer a question from the category on which the spinner lands (ie: lands on Science, the player is asked a question from the top card of the Science deck).

If the player is correct, they move their game piece one space t the right and they spin again to attempt to answer another question.  If their answer was incorrect, their turn is over.

When a player reaches a crown space on the game board or spins the Crown on the spinner, that player has a chance to earn a character token from a chosen category.  If they are correct, they receive the token and return to the beginning space and make their way back to the crown, otherwise they simply return to the beginning space without the token.

Name: Hey! Those Are My Glasses
Description:
Hey! Those Are My Glasses is a children's shape matching game. Each player starts with a lemur face in front of them and the goal is to collect the most shape-based glasses cards. A player flips the top glasses card and then rolls the die. If the shape of the die matches the glasses on the card, they get to keep it.  If not it stays on the table and the die is passed to the next player.  If on their turn a player rolls a shape that matches one or more of the glasses on the tables, they get to collect all of the matches.  Player with the most glasses cards at the end of the game is the winner!

-description from designer

Name: Tank Battles
Description:
Your tank rumbles into the bombed out ruins of a small town, a forest of jagged walls and rubble. Once a bustling town on a crossroads, it is now used as passage for supply trucks heading to the front line. Your mission is to hold this strategic location at any cost. But you’re not the only one with this mission. Other rival forces have sent their own armored units to secure the ruins. As a tank commander you’ll need to use your superior skills to win the day!

Tank Battles is an easy-to-learn, fast-paced game of tank combat with a surprising amount of tactical depth despite its simplicity. Take command of your battle tank(s) by moving and shooting each turn. Make difficult tactical decisions to stay alive and destroy enemy tanks. To win you’ll need to have the last tank left standing!

—description from the publisher

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Eckernförde
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Neumünster
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination

Name: Menukaarten: Het Flexitarisch Dinerspel
Description:
Cardgame Published by Foundation "Natuur&Milieu"

Light game that involves building menu's with different ingredients, based on the ecological footprint of the ingredients.

Players add ingredients (ranging in ecological footprint from -5 to 14 points) to a dish (set of cards) until the dish contains exactly 21 points of ingredients. The last player to add an ingredient wins the set.
To make the game more varied, some action cards are included that lets players start extra dishes, restrict the use of certain ingredients etc.
The player to finish the most dishes wins.

—user summary

Name: Vinyl: British Invasion
Description:
The British Invasion is a Vinyl band expansion that builds on the base game of Vinyl and introduces the Listening Booth and singles (aka 45s). Historically, 45s were purchased to initially and eventually encouraged buyers to acquire the associated LP album or even another album from the band. In BI, players can acquire 45s by matching the band icon. Each 45 has an "A-side" with locked attributes that can be unlocked at the Listening Booth. At the Listening Booth, players will discard a magazine card with one matching icon to flip the 45 to its "B-side" giving the player more points and the opportunity to use the 45 to acquire LPs with similar attributes in future rounds. BI leverages the same collection rewards system (Pure, Mixed, Double Mixed) that comes in the base game and can be further integrated with Top Shelf, Publisher Expansion, Clearance Bin, or even the memorabilia from Masters of Metal!

For 6 the new bands (Half & Half, Lead Balloon, Scarabs, The What, Rolling Bones, Pink Fluid), the following is included in this expansion:

     66 Magazine Cards
     72 LP Album Cards
     24 45s Cards


—description from the publisher

Name: My Little Castle
Description:
A free Print&Play game, simple to build and easy to carry around.

My Little Castle is a Tile Placement Puzzle, playable Solo, Couple or by 3-4 players.

Your aim is to build the best fief, full of Towers and with a mighty Castle. You do so by picking diamond tiles packed with villages, livestock, woods and fields.

When your domain outline a triangle-shaped void, that's a building site for a Tower. Outlining a hexagon you get to build the Castle.

Laying tiles it's crafty and competitive, get yourself a plan!

Game files can be found on the website for download.

-description by the designer

Name: Stalin's World War III
Description:
"Stalin's World War III" is a two wargame package: Part 1 – Operation Pincher & The Soviet Offensive in Europe; and Part 2 – Operation Sandown & The Soviet Offensive in the Mid-East. This is an alternative history monster-size wargame, designed by Ty Bomba, intended to investigate the strategic parameters that would’ve been in place during the first 10 weeks of operations had that dictator lived long enough to put in motion one of his many plans to start a global conflict in 1953.

The full combined grand campaign is over 3.5 mapsheets.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stop den Dieb
Description:
Up to 4 players can take part in the game. Each player receives one token and must throw a "6" on the dice to be able to start. If a "6" is thrown during the game the player is allowed to have another turn. "Throwing" the dice is done by means of a short, sharp tap on the knob of the dice box. If the figure reaches a number field, there is a special event (according to the game instructions).

—user summary

Name: Nusfjord: Plaice Deck
Description: Nusfjord: Plaice Deck contains 45 new cards for use with the Nusfjord base game. Also comes with metal coins, most useful to replace the coins from the first edition that were printed too small.

Name: Caverna: Cave vs Cave – Era II
Description:
In the two-player game Caverna: Cave vs. Cave, each player starts the game with only two dwarves and a small excavation in the side of a mountain. Over the course of eight rounds, they'll double their workforce, open up new living space in the mountain, construct new buildings and rooms in which to live, and dig for precious metals.

In Caverna: Cave vs Cave – Era II – The Iron Age, the players start exploring a side cave abundant in ore. Donkeys help you move the ore to the surface so that you can cast iron and forge weapons out of it — to protect your cave from anyone who wishes it harm, of course.

In the meantime, your tribe has grown four primates capable of work. Keep on collecting grains, fibers, and building resources to increase your wealth. Shortly you will be engaging in agriculture...

—description from the publisher

Name: Thou Sucketh
Description:
Who wants to be an Adventurer? Everyone! That’s why you’re willing to do anything, including sabotage your rivals, to be the best. You might conquer the Dragon’s Hoard or curse your enemies with Gorthak’s Tremulous Bowel. You might become a Boss-Killer or get Kicked in the Head by a Pissy Unicorn. All’s fair in love and adventuring!

Thou Sucketh is a hilarious fantasy-themed deck-building game, in which you take on the role of an aspiring adventurer. You not only buy awesome cards for yourself, you buy detrimental cards to put in your opponents’ decks! They can make life complicated, but in a funny way.

Game play is easy to learn. You generate resources from your hand, purchase cards for yourself or another’s deck, and compete for the most victory points in your deck at the end of the game. If you win, shout “Verily, I Ruleth!”

—description from the publisher

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Daggers in the Dark
Description:
Defend the Night's Watch with the Daggers in the Dark Chapter Pack for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game! The sixth and final entry in the "Dance of Shadows" cycle, this pack features the return of the Shadow keyword from the game's first edition to create new ways to conspire, as well as iconic characters and events that fully embrace the underhanded shadowplay!

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – In Daznak's Pit
Description:
Enter the fighting pits with the In Daznak's Pit Chapter Pack for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game! The fifth entry in the "Dance of Shadows" cycle, this pack features the return of the Shadow keyword from the game's first edition to create new ways to lay your traps, as well as powerful cards to counter your enemy's conspiracies!

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Montgisard
Description:
MONTGISARD is the name of the battle won by Baldwin IV, the Leper King of Jerusalem in 1177 against the Egyptian army of Saladin. This game is an extension for AGER SANGUINIS and introduces new knight Templar counters as well as famous characters like Reynald de Chatillon, Balian of Ibelin and the Leper King himself.

The game also includes a double-map of the famous 'Krak des Chevaliers' in order to supersede the old Templars Castle extension.

Box Contents:

> 4 full-color tactical maps, giving a possibility of many different terrains;
> 1 underground map;
> 2 full-color campaign maps;
> 3 A4 sheets of playing pieces printed in full color;
> One 40-page booklet of historical background and additional rules and both strategic and tactical scenarios;
> 6 play sheets for handy reference;
> 1 10-sided die.

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Beastmaster Th'Uk Tar – Hero Expansion
Description:
Bend the creatures of the Ru steppes to your will with the Beastmaster Th'Uk Tar – Hero Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! Marked by the Ynfernael with hooked feet and razor fangs, this Uthuk tribesman was destined for glory from infancy. Now a chieftain, he uses his unholy link to lead his pack to war, and all shall either submit or perish!

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Prince Faolan – Hero Expansion
Description:
Call upon a new leader to guide the Latari with the Prince Faolan – Hero Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! After his rash military strategies led to his father's death, Prince Faolan wandered the forest with his loyal cyrssaerele, Silanel, as his only companion. Now, as the Aymhelin falls under threat, he abandons his self-imposed exile to lead the elves to war once more!

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Ventala Skirmishers – Unit Expansion
Description:
Defend the borders of the Aymhelin Forest with the Ventala Skirmishers – Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! Since they first appeared in Mennara centuries ago, the Ventala have developed a deep friendship with the Latari. Now, these enigmatic creatures are proud to offer their services as scouts and warriors. Pledge your loyalty and protect your elven allies!

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Viper Legion – Unit Expansion
Description:
Deliver death from afar with the Viper Legion – Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! These cunning circumspect warriors may prove more dangerous than the Uthuk's demons or berserkers as they use their poison-tipped arrows to strike the heart of their enemies from great distances. Learn the secrets of the serpents and purge the unworthy from the world!

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Obscenes – Unit Expansion
Description:
Surrender to the power of the Ynfernael with the Obscenes – Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! These twisted, warped warriors shed their frail selves in exchange for toughened skins split with spikes, gorging on the power of the Ynfernael. Now, with increased strength, they shall feast on the enemies of the Uthuk until nothing living remains!

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Emperor Palpatine Commander Expansion
Description:
Sitting at the head of the mighty Galactic Empire, Emperor Palpatine is the supreme authority in the galaxy. A brilliant manipulator who almost singlehandedly orchestrated the fall of the Jedi order and his own rise to power, the Emperor makes a perfect addition to Star Wars: Legion as a commander of your Imperial forces. Within the Emperor Palpatine Commander Expansion, you'll find everything you need to add Emperor Palpatine to your army as a commander — leading the Imperial forces on his own or alongside another Imperial commander like his apprentice, Darth Vader. A single unpainted, easily assembled miniature depicts a cloaked Emperor Palpatine plotting his next move, while three upgrade cards allow you to tap into his mastery of the dark side of the Force. Finally, three new command cards give you more options for determining your battle plans, letting you make use of the Emperor’s abilities as a master strategist.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Imperial Royal Guards Unit Expansion
Description:
Inscrutable behind their blood-red masks, the Imperial Royal Guard will face down anyone who dares threaten the Emperor. While little is known about these enigmatic warriors, one thing is certain: their sole directive is to protect the leader of the Galactic Empire, with their lives if necessary.

The Imperial Royal Guards Unit Expansion contains everything you need to add a unit of Emperor Palpatine's personal bodyguards to your army. The squad of four unpainted, easily assembled miniatures stands ready to protect the Emperor or do his bidding on any planet across the galaxy. Meanwhile, the Royal Guards are also accompanied by five distinct upgrade cards that invite you to outfit them with even more tools for protecting the Emperor.

—description from the publisher

Name: Panda Rollers
Description:
Shake the panda head to shake the dice and then everyone races to be the first player to match their Panda cards to the eye colors of the dice shown in the panda's eyes. The first player to match their Panda cards to the Panda dice shaker wins a reward tile.

Reward tiles can give players one or two bamboo pieces, or a fortune cookie. If a player draws a fortune cookie, that player can choose 2 reward tiles.  Once all the reward tiles are gone, players add up their tiles. The player with most bamboo wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Nurgle's Rotters – Nurgle Blood Bowl Team
Description:
The Rotters rose to fame long ago, having the distinction of being one of the earliest Chaos teams on the circuit to dedicate themselves to a single Chaos god – Grandfather Nurgle himself. Their patron was delighted, lavishing gifts and mutations upon his favoured followers. Today, despite numerous recent setbacks, the Rotters stand poised to once again spread their influence across the leagues and tournaments of the world, bringing Nurgle’s blessings to lands far and wide…

This multi-part plastic kit contains the components necessary to assemble Nurgle’s Rotters, a particularly foul and dripsome Nurgle team for use in games of Blood Bowl. Appropriately putrid and ‘orrible, each player is mutated and pus-covered with exposed guts, claws and warts featuring heavily. The team consists of 4 Bloaters, 2 Pestigor and 6 Rotters.

There are a host of extras in the kit – 2 turn markers, 2 double-sided score coins in the shape of Nurgle’s icon and 4 balls – 2 of these are being chomped upon by a cheeky Nurgling, and 2 have… something… emerging from them, all gribbly teeth and eldritch horror. Supplied with 12 32mm Blood Bowl bases, a 1,000,000 GP roster and a Nurgle transfer sheet.

description from publisher's website

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Nurgle Team Card Pack
Description:
This is a pack of 43 handy reference cards for a Nurgle Blood Bowl team, along with blank cards allowing every coach to create their own players! Contained in the pack:

- Reference cards for Rotters, Pestigors, Bloaters and Rotspawn;
- Reference cards for the following Star Players: Guffle Pusmaw, Lord Borak the Despoiler, Grashnak Blackhoof, Max Spleenripper, Bilerot Vomitflesh, Withergrasp Doubledrool, Lewdgrip Whiparm, Buboe Shardhorn, Tolly Glocklinger, and Morg 'N' Thorg;
- The following blank cards that you can use to create your own players: 8 Rotters,5 Pestigors, 5 Bloaters, and 3 Rotspawn;
- A team roster card, with match record on the reverse;
- 4 Dirty Tricks cards: Public Inconvenience, Plentiful Poxes, Sweat Socks, and Suppurating Sores;
- 3 Random Events cards: Bountiful Growth, 'Pus' The Ball, The Excitement is Contagious!;
- The most important card: a card explaining how to use the other cards.

description from publisher's website

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Nurgle Pitch & Dugout Set
Description:
A double-sided card Blood Bowl pitch, complete with matching dug-outs, this is the perfect place for your Nurgle teams to play. One side represents a beautiful*, flowering** Garden of Nurgle, with plants and trees gaily littering the pitch and maggots cheerily infesting the end zones; the other side is, uh, ‘self-fertilised’ – due to this there are far more hazards in place, with betoothed plants, pools of slime and a great big horrible tentacle waving about. The dug-outs are themed to match, and feature score trackers, reserves, Knocked Out and Serious Injury boxes, Down trackers for both halves, and a re-roll tracker.

The pitch is made to the same specifications as the board included with the Blood Bowl boxed game, and includes rules for play with the sticky plant life trying to hinder your match.

description from publisher's website

Name: Prosper
Description: Immerse yourself in the stories and the people of the Book of Mormon in this fun new game for the whole family. If you match a card in your hand with one of the images on the colorful game board, you get to place one of your colored markers. Get five markers in a row and your opponents can’t stop you — but until then, watch out for the Laban card that will let them take one of your markers and hinder your progress. Be the first to get three rows of five markers each and you win! Find out how fun it is to Prosper in the land!

Name: Spoils of War: Singing Stone
Description:
Available from Bower's Game Corner Presents: Gen Con Video Bonanza 2017 Kickstarter campaign.

Artifact: When a Viking makes a dice bid, you may ask them to reveal 2 dice that match their bid. If they do not, you may look through their Stash and take a Treasure.

Name: Spoils of War: Lance's Axe
Description:
Available from Bower's Game Corner Presents: Gen Con Video Bonanza 2017 Kickstarter campaign.

Artifact: This item counts as both a Battle Ax and an Artifact.

Name: Der Krieg beim Tisch
Description:
Wargame for two players, printed in Czech Republic in 1940. 
Precise wooden components.

Name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Shelter Upgrades
Description:
Four Shelter upgrades tiles, that will allow you to add more flavor and special features for your Robinson Crusoe shelter!

Four tiles are printed on a high quality cardboard.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Robinson Crusoe – Adventures on the Cursed Island

Name: Merit International: Sports Car Racing Game
Description:
As read on the front box: "An Exciting Game for two to four players" 
This game is a very simple ancestor of Speed Circuit and it is dated back in 1960 printed in England. There's a speedometer in the center of the mapboard and depending on how much speed you want to give to your car, you spin it. If you get a result of trouble you are blocked until the arrow of your car spinner (in the pits 1-2-3-4) goes to the space of appropriate problem resolution .

Name: Alles was fliegt
Description:
Game Material:
24 cards with different flying things (e.g. butterfly, witch, comet). Each card has a colored dot on the backside, representing the height it flies.
color die

Game rules
All cards are places face up in the middle of the table.
At players turn he roles the die and chooses a card he thinks has the right color (height) on the back. If he is right he gets the card. If no card of this color (height)is in the middle the player is allowed to take a card from another player.

Target of the game:
The first player who has all 6 cards of 1 height wins.

Variants:
Collect all heights: Have 1 of each 6 heights to win
Easy/Beginner variant: Place all cards with the back sides (color/height visible) in the middle.

Detail variant:
Place all cards in the middle face up. 1 player describes a detail on a choosen image. The player who finds the right card first gets the card. Game ends when only 5 cards are left. The player with the most cards wins.

Name: Pussycat
Description:
The cheese smells very well! But the mice can't get to it, since Pussycat sits in ambush!
A funny card game for children from  to 8.

Name: Alles was fährt: Von ganz langsam bis ganz schnell
Description:
Game Material:
24 cards with different things (e.g. car, inline scates) which can drive with different velocities.

3 games can be played with this cards:
1. Try to sort all cards from small to fast. 1+ players
2. Domino: All cards have 2 little images at the 2 ends of the card. This can be used for playing domino.
3. trick-game: The highest velocity wins. The speed is shown at the backside as number and as a red line (the longest line is the fastest thing).

Name: Zingaro
Description: In this game, several gipsies play poker with their golden rings.

Name: Pinguin Club
Description: This is a jump & run game with penguins.

Name: Die Lustigen Frösche: Wer ist zuerst über dem Teich?
Description:
Card driven race with frogs.
Each player has a frog which he tries to run as fast as possible on a path of water lilies.
The speed is not given by a die, it's given by the number on the card you get from the top of a stack.
There are some single cards with negativ values, which have the result that you go back this number of fields.
The player who is first on the other side of the pond (end of the path) win the game.

Name: Lustige Rheinfahrt
Description:
Funny trip on the rhine
This is a travel and geography game on the river Rhine. It's a jump and run game with some events on top of that.

Name: Das Pinocchio Spiel
Description: This is an interesting variant for a jump and run game where the players start by creating their own route in the first phase by selecting some of their cards. In the second phase, they eventually use this route.

Name: Knobelix
Description: This is an interesting variant of a dice game: The active player rolls all the dices, but only the other players can see them. By deducing, the active player can find out what was his original result of the dice roll.

Name: La Clave
Description:
Guess the hidden word. A two-player deduction game where each player takes turn making a limited number of guesses, using logic to deduce what word the opponent has hidden.

One player secretly puts a five-letter word in the spaces behind a screen at once end of the game board. The other player, the code breaker, makes a series of guesses. After each guess, the code maker uses pins to tell the code breaker if their guessed letters are the right letter in the right place (using a white pin), are the right letter but the wrong place (using a black pin), or are the wrong letter entirely (no pin is used). The code breaker makes another guess in the next row, building upon information from previous guesses, trying to match the letters (and word) the code maker hid at the beginning of the game.

La Clave was inspired from Mastermind.

Name: Ornamenta
Description:
128 square cards which show 1 or multiple parts of circles.
1 player builds an figur of 4x4 cards and the other players try to rebuild it as fast as possible with the remaining cards.

    


variant:
1. exchange the 2 colors green and orange
2. build the mirrowed image.

Name: Trivio 2.000: La Fuerza del Saber
Description: The goal of this game is to answer correctly 6 green questions and 1 final red question to get the Power of Knowledge and go out of the Atom.

Name: El País del Antichollo
Description:
The board game adaptation of one of the "consolation games" seen in the popular spanish TV show "Un, dos, tres... Responda otra vez". The players must advance trough the board facing challenges and popular culture questions. When they succeed, they receive money, and when they don't, they lose it. Also, the board is divided in numbered sections. If the dices sums the number of the section in with the player token stands, the "antichollo" eats them and they lose all their money, but keep playing. The one who has more money when the first player reach the other side of the board, wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Carrera de Caballos
Description:
Try to win the horse races and take all the money as you can.

A lively game of horse racing where players bet on one of five horses to try to gain the most money by the end of the game.

One player, the Horseride Manager, reveals action cards one by one and moves each horse as indicated. The five horses vary in strength, but even the weakest horses have some amazing bursts of speed taking advantage of any kind of mistake. Finally, there are money tokens now for the winners and a new horse race is prepared.

After six races the winner is the player who get more money.

Name: Pixel Glory: Light & Shadow – Sneaky Wizards Expansion
Description:
A 4-player expansion for the co-op mode in Pixel Glory: Light and Shadow.

Sneaky Wizards adds a new Hidden Identity game mode where players have hidden objectives - some are even working for the Dungeon lord! Players earn fame for completing their objectives, and for successfully guessing what the other players roles are.

How to play: Each player gets a random role card. Each role has a secret objective(s). Players earn fame (victory point) for completing their hidden objectives - not from killing monsters.

At the end of the game, players guess what role each other player was (on paper). For each successful guess, they earn 1 additional fame.

Roles:

The Hoarder (Good Role)
End the game with at least 3 combo points - 1 Fame.
Survive the dungeon - 2 Fame.

The Nimble (Good Role)
End the game with the most health remaining - 1 Fame.
Survive the dungeon - 2 Fame.

The Proud (Good Role)
End the game without defeating a 1 fame monster - 1 Fame.
Survive the dungeon - 2 Fame.

The Traitor (2x, Evil Role)
The wizards are defeated - 3 Fame.

The Mercenary (Neutral Role)
Survive the dungeon, or be the last player remaining - 1 Fame.
End the game with the most fame from defeated monsters - 1 Fame.
End the game without healing any other player - 1 Fame.


Contains 10 Cards: 6 Role Cards and 4 Reference Cards.

Name: Wettrennspiel "Toto"
Description: This game combines a flat race and a steeple chase and the option to bet on the results. There are two separate race tracks for both races. Movement is determined by one die. On some spaces certain events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Speedrone: Fly or Die
Description:
Speedrone: Fly or Die is a board game about mad deadly races between high-tech drones in a near future (2050). The goal is to win the race with your drone collecting as many Acceleration cards you can.

In this period the military technologies become common and spread among civil people. Children and adults from every class of the society begin to build their own fighting drones in order to run in clandestine and official races. To achieve victory they are ready to do everything legal and illegal: there was no chance for pity or alliances, but only for the dangerous gadgets that drones equip.

Speedrone: Fly or Die! it's a modular game: with a box you can play up to 5 players, with two boxes up to 10 and with 3 boxes up to 15 and so on. It's very simple and you do not need any extra components: the manual included in Speedrone - fly or die! - already contains everything you need to know.

The game-play is very simple: every player acts in a specific order that changes during the game, draws cards and plays every cards he/she wants. Acceleration cards drive you to the victory, other cards like Shellfire force you to lose positions; many cards protect drones from the deadly gadgets of the game and other cards called Event tell you in which situation you are in that round. There are a lot of cards and a high combination of strategies in Speedrone.

—description from the designer

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Lando's Millennium Falcon Expansion Pack
Description:
Experience the history of the iconic Millennium Falcon as you usher in a new era of space combat in the Star Wars galaxy with the Lando's Millennium Falcon Expansion Pack for X-Wing Second Edition!

Featuring a beautifully sculpted Millennium Falcon miniature with a detachable escape craft as seen in Solo: A Star Wars Story, this expansion gives you another option for your Scum and Villainy squadron. The pack's thirteen upgrade cards accentuate the Falcon's abilities with gunners, modifications, and crew including Chewbacca and Lando Calrissian. Meanwhile, pilots for both the customized YT-1300 Light Freighter and the Escape Craft provide a wealth of tactical options in the heat of battle.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Looking For Healer
Description:
Looking For Healer is a love letter to the experiences you had partying up with horrible people in MMOs. Players take the role of the healer in a pickup group of ... just the worst party of randoms. Players can pick from three healer classes with unique skills to keep their allies alive against tough boss battles.

Turns have two phases: the boss phase and the healer phase. In the boss phase, players draw an action card from the boss's card deck. These cards can be attacks, summoned minions, or events of your party doing something stupid. These will cause your party to lose health.

During the healer phase, you respond with the healing spell cards in your hand. From your standard Heal over Time spells and direct healing spells, to shields and resurrection spells, each of the three healer classes has plenty of tools to help restore your allies. Once spells are played, they go on a cooldown where you cannot use them for some time. An important facet of the strategy is thinking ahead to have the right spell ready at the right time.

Keep your allies from dying (to the boss or to their own stupidity) and victory will be yours!

Good luck. Have fun.

—description from the designer

Name: Star Wars: Legion – 1.4 FD Laser Cannon Team Unit Expansion
Description:
No matter where the Rebel Alliance establishes one of its bases, it must always be prepared for an Imperial attack. Rebel troopers are always willing to put themselves in harm's way, but sometimes foot soldiers aren't enough to stem the tide of the Imperial legions and their heavy walkers. These times call for something with a little bit more power — something like the 1.4 FD Laser Cannon.

The 1.4 FD Laser Cannon Team Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion includes a single 1.4 FD laser cannon team miniature that you can field as a support unit in your Rebel army. Along with the miniature, you'll find the associated unit card and three upgrade cards that invite you to further modify your cannon's generator, making it an even more stalwart line of defense against the forces of the Empire.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – E-Web Heavy Blaster Team Unit Expansion
Description:
Imperial troops are known for their relentless assaults, pressing the attack even in the face of the strongest Rebel resistance. But when the Empire really wants to bring the fight to the Rebels, it calls in its E-Web Heavy Blaster teams.

The E-Web Heavy Blaster Team Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion includes an unpainted, easily assembled E-Web Heavy Blaster Team miniatures that can be used as a support unit in your Imperial army. Additionally, three upgrade cards give you the power to customize your heavy blaster team to improve its communications or modify its power generator to create new ways to attack.

—description from the publisher

Name: Clusterfight!: The Gang's All Here!
Description:
Expansion for Clusterfight!:

"The People have spoken, and Clusterfight! has listened... but you will soon find that the wacky game of what-ifs isn't pulling any punches.  THE GANG'S ALL HERE fills your fights with fan favorites: new fighters and items, treacherous (and often hilarious) locales, and absurb situations!

You want more? Get ready for more."

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Lord Vorun'thul – Hero Expansion
Description:
Expand Waiqar's army with the Lord Vorun'thul – Hero Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game!

A once noble and stalwart knight, by pledging himself to Waiqar the undying, Lord Vorun'thul transformed into a fearsome vampire. With this duality, Lord Vorun'thul is the first Runewars Miniatures Game character to transform mid-battle, alternating between his humanoid form, and the terrifying Vorun'thul the Cursed.

This means that Lord Vorun'thul enters battles with two different unit cards and will swap between both figures and unit cards as the battle progresses, always using the same command dial. Lord Vorun'thul is versatile and fearsome, and your opponents will never know what to expect from the once-honorable knight!

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Baron Zachareth – Hero Expansion
Description:
Defend the barony of Carthridge with the Baron Zachareth – Hero Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! Ever since he first assumed power under suspicious circumstances, Baron Zachareth has been a divisive figure. Some call him a hero, others a warmonger, but with the ability to inspire his allies and intimidate his enemies, Zachareth will defend Terrinoth whether the victories are bought with honor or with blood.

—description from the publisher

Name: Poor Choices: Purple Rain Expansion
Description: The First Expansion Pack includes 112 brand new cards that work well when combined with the Classic Edition.

Name: Moomery
Description: Challenge the other players in a test of speed and memory in Moomery. Remember all the cards in the stack in front of you and be the first to strike when you are sure two identical cards are in the pack. Watch out for the tricky cow!

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Music of Dragons
Description:
Feed the fire of your ambition with the Music of Dragons Chapter Pack for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game! The fourth entry in the "Dance of Shadows" cycle, this pack features fell beasts and the return of the Shadow keyword from the game's first edition, allowing you to draw out your enemy's plans and find your moment to strike!

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Slave I Expansion Pack
Description:
Originally produced for law enforcement purposes, the Firespray-class patrol craft became a favorite of bounty hunters across the galaxy, including the infamous Boba Fett. The ship's robust chassis offers plenty of space for additional weaponry and other less-than-legal modifications. The Slave I Expansion Pack for X-Wing Second Edition gives Scum pilots the chance to fly one of these versatile ships into a new era of space combat.

With a beautifully pre-painted ship miniature as well as all the ship cards, upgrade cards, and tokens you need to get flying, this expansion gives you a vast array of options for customizing your own Firespray-class patrol craft and adding it to your squadron.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Boba Fett Operative Expansion
Description:
Boba Fett, one of the most notorious bounty hunters in the Star Wars galaxy, is coming to Star Wars: Legion as the game's first operative. Within the Boba Fett Operative Expansion, you'll  find everything you need to add Boba Fett to your Imperial army as an operative dominating entire sections of the battlefield on his own.

This expansion includes an unpainted, easily assembled Boba Fett miniature taking flight after his next target, alongside a unit card outlining his numerous skills and deadly array of weaponry. Additionally, Boba Fett's three signature command cards and an assortment of upgrade cards let you access even more tricks tucked away in his intimidating Mandalorian armor.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Scout Troopers Unit Expansion
Description:
Pave the way for the Empire with the Scout Troopers Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! Whether you need troops capable of locating and securing key points on the battlefield or specialized strike teams who can move in close to eliminate opposing squads before enemy forces can react, the Scout Troopers are ready for a wide range of missions.

Within the Scout Troopers Unit Expansion, you'll find seven unpainted Scout Trooper miniatures that can be used to field two different special forces units: a standard squad or a two-miniature strike team outfitted with specialized weaponry. Supplementing these troops are an assortment of upgrade cards that invite you to vary your tactics and make your Scout Troopers lethal from any range.

—description from the publisher

Name: MRD Roadgame
Description: Roll-and-move game following a path of 70 numbered spaces along the main highways of Western Australia from Eucla to Wyndham. Various spaces offer thematic bonuses or penalties, including detours and dead-end highways.

Name: Red Prinsessen
Description:
In this game the player roll a die to move their knight or one of the monsters around the board. Player cannot cross a space with a monster. If you catch the princess you have to return to your castle to win, if another player catches you while you are carrying the princess, you will be sent home while the other player takes the princess.
—user summary

Save the Princess
Knights and monsters

Scarribly Entertaining
The beautiful princess has been kidnapped by the evil monsters of the forest, and the kingdom is in sorrow and crisis. As a young and talented knight-in-learning it's your job to save the princess and bring her back to your castle.

Can you avoid the monsters and the competing knights and bring the princess back to safety?

Save the Princess is a simple and catching game, built with few and simple rules, and a catching adventurous design, which makes the game fun for both children and childish people.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Red Prinsessen
Riddere og monstre

Uhyggeligt Underholdende
Den smukke prinsesse er blevet kidnappet af skovens onde monstre og det ganske kongerige er nu kastet ud i en stor sorg og krise. Som ung og talentfuld ridder-lærling er din opgave at redde prisessen og bringe hende uskadt tilbage i sikkerhed på dit slot.

Kan du slippe uden om monstrene og de andre rivaliserende riddere og bringe prinsessen tilbage i sikkerhed?

Red Prinsessen er et enkelt og fængende spil, der er bygget op med få og enkle spilleregler og et eventyrligt design, der gør det sjovt for både børn og andre barnlige sjæle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Savana
Description:
Winning the trick is great when the cards features winning points. Unfortunately you don't always know in advance what the other players will play.

Savana is a trick taking card game, with four families of 12 cards each (elephants, lions, hyenas or zebras), each cards also have a value 1-12, and green stars (positive points) or red stars (negative points), zebra cards have no stars, but some have special rules. Cards must lead or be a zebra, if a player can't lead or play a zebra he may play any cards. Highest card in the family or zebra wins the round, family trumps zebra in case of ties.

Once the last cards has been played, players count their points, and whoever has the most points wins.

Name: Magnus Rex
Description:
Magnus Rex ("Great King") is a classic 4X civilization builder with aspects of map-building, resource management, and deck building.  Use the resources at your disposal to achieve a victory in Science, Culture, Economics, or Conquest!

Magnus Rex is played through 4 technological ages -- Ancient, Medieval, Industrial and Modern. Endgame strategy will dictate the tempo of the game and how far into the ages the game progresses.  The Ancient era is one of exploration and resource exploitation.  Medieval era features a technological Renaissance and the expansion of trade.  The late-game Industrial and Modern eras offer powerful endgame powers gained through negotiation, espionage, and World Wonders.

If you are nostalgic for a boardgame with that 'One More Turn' feeling from PC-era Civilization, this is the game for you!

—description from the designer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d4l_yKy0pQk

Name: Crazy Ducks
Description:
Turtles have 4 legs, flamingos only have 1 and the ducks have 2... Except the player's secret ducks which have 3! Can you uncover your opponents' ducks by counting legs?

Each player starts by drawing a secret duck tile. For that player each duck of that colour has 3 legs, all other ducks have 2 legs. Turtles have 4 legs, and flamingos have 1 leg.

Each player starts with 3 tiles on their hand, and 1 tile is player centrally in the table. On a players turn the player have to play 2-3 tiles in a row or column, adding it to cards already on the table. The following player have to announce how many legs there are in the just played row/column; according to that player. Once you figure out which secret duck a player has, you shout out the colour. If you guess correct you score all the tiles on the table. If you guess wrong the player you tried to guess score all the tiles on the table. Then a new round is played until all tiles are used. The winner is the player with the most scored tiles.

Name: Daimyo's Fall: Dice Tuners
Description:
Daimyo's Fall - Dice Tuners is a fast-paced anime combat game for 2-4 players. Recruit the best warriors and fight in close quarter battles against multiple opponents.

Choose your guard and counter the attacks that will come from each direction. The position of players around the table actually matters, like in a real melee fight you have to raise your guard against your fearful opponents, choosing a parry maneuver for each incoming attack.

A round is divided in 3 turns, in each turn dice are rolled by the first player. There are 3 types of dice, each type representing a guard (high>mid>low>high) and a type of action (attack, defense, sheathe).

Players can choose only one die per turn and they place it in one of the three directions, determining how they will parry the incoming attacks and strike back from each direction that turn.

The leftover die  determines the type of card that can be played that turn, but be careful: you'll need those cards to recruit new heroes in the next round, so carefully choose which ones to keep in your hand and which to play.

When a hero suffers a wound, the player who inflicted it gains a point. The game ends in 3 rounds. At the end of the game, the highest score wins.

Name: Gods of Metal: The Chosen
Description:
Your home, a land of steel, blood, and death is being threatened. Creatures from Outside have been trying to gain entry for centuries and the Gods of Metal have held them off. Until now, these creatures were a loose band of demons and other things attacking weakly and easily repelled. Lately they’ve been getting bolder. Tales of the great demon lords rallying together to make a final run are spreading. If they make it through, the universe is lost. The creatures of darkness stand at the edge of your realm, their malicious intent is plain in their stance. The creatures charge. The Gods of Metal reach out to gather together the greatest band in history and use the power of Metal to stop their advancing darkness, that’s where you come in. 
Your van is bouncing down yet another lonely highway when the flash of lightning chars your engine. Each of you step out, cursing the bolt that took your van. Just then, another bolt strikes a short distance away, the thunder driving you back. A figure made of pure electricity walks towards you. You’ve been chosen. You are all that will stand between the Universe and Darkness.

Gods of Metal: The Chosen is a game of destruction and greatness for 1-4 Players! Each player will take the role of one of a Band Member chosen by the God of Metal seeking to defend the Universe against the demonic forces seeking to gain entry. The Overlords wants to destroy these lands by sending minions to attack the land’s defenses. To win and save everything, the players must work together to defeat the Overlords!

Name: Rick and Morty: Close Rick-Counters of the Rick Kind Deck-Building Game – Promo Rick
Description:
Promo Rick originally was included with the first printing of Rick and Morty: Close Rick-Counters of the Rick Kind Deck-Building Game, and was subsequently made available via other means.

It is compatible with any Cryptozoic Cerberus Deck-Building game.

Promo Rick has the following ability: At the end of your turn, if you bought or gained two or more different card types, draw two extra cards, and then discard a card.

Name: Occupation Double: Le jeu
Description:
All the remarkable elements of the popular tv show "Occupation Double" are gathered in this exciting board game that will surprise you. Guys, girls, eliminations, adventures, challenges and more! Make yourself heard during the eliminations, and be clever in your playing method so that one of your couple wins the "Occupation double" adventure.

Inspired by the television dating game show, you play "singles" that wants to match and win the game. To do so, you must answer questions do different kind of challenges.

Name: Thunderpwn: Post Apocalyptic Arena Combat
Description:
Thunderpwn: Post-Apocalyptic Arena Combat is a card/board game for 2-6 players who want to brawl to the death using hand-to-hand combat and makeshift weapons! Thunderpwn is tactical, cinematic and packed with kinetic action that you will feel as you play!

It was developed in Little Rock Arkansas by PWN Productions and nurtured by the large community of gamers and friends that live in and around central Arkansas!

—description from the designer

Name: Star Realms: Universal Storage Box
Description:
This box will hold your entire Star Realms collection, with or without sleeves, with room to spare for future sets and even a playmat! Use the included foam blocks to hold your cards firmly in place. The high quality plastic dividers included will allow you to separate your cards by set, and/or have a deck ready to play with dividers for Trade Deck, Explorers, Personal Decks and Score Cards.

Contents:
15-Card promo & Token Card Set of the following cards:
 - 1x Young Queen (Blob Ship)
 - 1x Mutant Drone (Blob Ship)
 - 2x Worker Drone (Blob Ship)
 - 3x Warrior Drone (Blob Ship)
 - 2x Brooder (Blob Ship)
 - 2x Recovery Mech (Machine Cult Ship)
 - 2x Orbital Crane (Star Empire Ship)
 - 2x Embassy Transport (Trade Federation Ship)

30 Plastic Dividers
6 Foam Blocks
